abstracts.cdata!:
The Philippines Early Childhood
            Development Project has a satisfactory outcome, is likely to
            be sustainable, and has a substantial institutional
            development impact. The performances of the Borrower and the
            Bank are rated satisfactory. In addition to more well-known
            lessons learned comparable operations such as the need for
            local level involvement, strategic communications
            development early in project and the importance of
            integrating services, this operation provides other
            interesting lessons such as: 1) focusing on nutrition within
            an early childhood development program; 2) the value added
            of a strong evaluation of the ECD program in addition to
            regular monitoring; 3) the use of baseline surveys; 4) the
            choice of lead agency in a multi-sectoral operation; 5) the
            scope of ECD services; 6) the use of matching grants to
            encourage local government financing; 7) the successful
            combination of legislation and the information, education,
            and communication thrust; and 8) embedding the project
            management office within the organic structure of the lead
            implementing agencies.

5080112.trustfund:
TF022742-PHRD-WOMEN'S HEALTH &
            SAFE MOTHERHOOD,TF038653-PHILIPPINES:  EARLY CHILDHOOD
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF038048-PHILIPPINES - EARLY CHILDHOOD
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF029613-PHRD-EARLY CHILD DEVELOPMENT PROJ.,TF032654-INDONESIA - EDUCATION

abstracts.cdata!:
The Early Childhood Development (ECD)
            Project's objectives are : a) to contribute to the
            attainment of human development goals by providing services
            that ensure survival and promote the physical and mental
            development of Filipino children; and b) to establish an
            effective partnership between national and local governments
            in the provision of ECD services. The project components are
            as follows: a) Service delivery provides program support for
            provincial local government units (LGUs), which includes an
            expanded program of immunization package, an integrated
            management of child illness package, a micronutrient
            malnutrition prevention and control package, a parent
            effectiveness service package, and a Grade 1 Early Child
            Experience(ECE)/ECD package. This component will also
            finance facilities for municipal/city LGUs who wish to
            invest in upgrading of their ECD services. b) Support to
            service delivery will support the LGUs in implementing their
            investment packages in the areas of communications,
            planning, targeting, management information system,
            training, human resource development, and institutional
            development. c) Research and development (R&D) will
            finance R&D activities needed to support effective ECD
            program implementation, including initial piloting of new
            field-level technical interventions.
